thread.title: Canandaigua animal shelter temporarily closed due to parvovirus concerns
thread.title_full: Canandaigua animal shelter temporarily closed due to parvovirus concerns

author: WHAM
title: Canandaigua animal shelter temporarily closed due to parvovirus concerns
text:
Canandaigua, N.Y. — The Happy Tails Animal Shelter in Canandaigua has been closed until further notice as a precautionary measure following concerns over parvovirus.
The closure comes in the wake of a recent animal cruelty case in Geneva, where two people — Dawn Cameron, 42, and Dustin Bush, 39 — are charged after 11 dogs were seized last Monday from poor living conditions at a home on Middle Street, according to the Ontario County Humane Society.
Some of those dogs reportedly developed parvovirus and were placed in quarantine, where they're receiving the care they need.
The shelter is undergoing a thorough cleaning process to ensure the safety of all animals.
Cameron and Bush are both charged with 11 counts of animal cruelty.
The humane society is coordinating with veterinary technicians to ensure the best possible care for all shelter animals.
____
